Qinan Yu
About Publications

Qinan Yu 喻启楠

I am a first-year student in Computer Science at Stanford University. Currently, I am rotating with Professor Chris Potts and Professor Carlos Guestrin. My Ph.D. is generously supported by Stanford Graduate Fellowship

Before Stanford, I received a concurrent B.S. in Math-CS and M.A. in CS from Brown University where I was fortunate to be advised by Professor Ellie Pavlick.

My research focuses on Natural Language Processing, specifically in interpretability and trustworthyness of language models. I'm interested in understanding how language models work internally and improving their capabilities.

email github google scholar twitter

I am a first-year student in Computer Science at Stanford University. Currently, I am rotating with Professor Chris Potts and Professor Carlos Guestrin. My Ph.D. is generously supported by Stanford Graduate Fellowship

Before Stanford, I received a concurrent B.S. in Math-CS and M.A. in CS from Brown University where I was fortunate to be advised by Professor Ellie Pavlick.

News

  • May 2025
    Our paper Improved Representation Steering for Language Models is now available on arXiv.
  • Jan 2025
    Our paper "The Same But Different: Structural Similarities and Differences in Multilingual Language Modeling" is accepted into ICLR 2025.
  • Sep 2024
    Start my PhD at Stanford.
